# watchOS Swift Stack References

## Official Documentation

- [watchOS Apps](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/watchos-apps)
- [SwiftUI](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/swiftui)
- [WidgetKit](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/widgetkit)
- [WatchConnectivity](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/watchconnectivity)
- [HealthKit](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/healthkit)

## Human Interface Guidelines

- [Designing for watchOS](https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/designing-for-watchos)
- [Complications](https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/complications)

## Key Concepts

### Complications
Watch face widgets that display glanceable information. Use WidgetKit with timeline providers.

### WatchConnectivity
Framework for iPhone-Watch communication. Supports background transfers and real-time messaging.

### Battery Efficiency
watchOS apps should minimize network usage, use background refresh sparingly, and optimize for quick interactions.

### Screen Sizes
- 41mm: 176 x 215 pixels
- 45mm: 198 x 242 pixels

## Sample Code

- [Creating a watchOS App](https://developer.apple.com/tutorials/swiftui/creating-a-watchos-app)
- [Building Widgets](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/widgetkit/creating-a-widget-extension)
